ShouldersCBStandingReverseFly.name: Cable Reverse Fly
ShouldersCBStandingReverseFly.preparation: Stand facing twin pulley cables positioned close together and approximately shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Step back away from machine so cable is taut. Stand with feet staggered. Point elbows outward with arms straight or slightly bent.
ShouldersCBStandingReverseFly.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, maintaining stiff elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat.
ShouldersCBStandingReverseFly.comments: Upper arms should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize Latissimus Dorsi involvement.
ShouldersCBStandingReverseFly.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltPull.name: Cable Seated Reverse Fly
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltPull.preparation: Sit on seat facing twin pulley cables positioned approximately shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Straighten lower back upright so cable is taut. Point elbows outward with arms slightly bent.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltPull.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull stirrups out to sides, maintaining slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltPull.comments: Upper arms should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize Latissimus Dorsi involvement.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltPull.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersCBRearDeltPull.name: Cable One Arm Reverse Fly
ShouldersCBRearDeltPull.preparation: Stand with side to shoulder height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup cable attachment with hand furthest from pulley. Position arm across neck with elbow bent 30 to 45 outward.
ShouldersCBRearDeltPull.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull stirrup out to side, maintaining fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat. Repeat with other arm.
ShouldersCBRearDeltPull.comments: Upper arm should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize Latissimus Dorsi involvement.
ShouldersCBRearDeltPull.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersCBSupineRearLateralRaise.name: Cable Supine Reverse Fly
ShouldersCBSupineRearLateralRaise.preparation: With bench between two high pulleys to each side, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Lie on bench with pulleys to each side of shoulders. Arms should be crossed above upper chest with elbows slightly bent.
ShouldersCBSupineRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull upper arms down to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (just slightly bent) as arms are pulled down to sides. Return arms to original position and repeat.
ShouldersCBSupineRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel perpendicular to torso to minimize latissimus dorsi involvement. Elbows may bend slightly at top of movement (as shown) or they may be kept fixed.
ShouldersCBSupineRearLateralRaise.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersCBRearDeltRow.name: Cable Rear Delt Row
ShouldersCBRearDeltRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp cable bar attachment. With elbow width overhand grip, straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent.
ShouldersCBRearDeltRow.execution: Pull cable attachment toward upper chest, just below neck, with elbows up out to sides until elbows travel slightly behind back. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
ShouldersCBRearDeltRow.comments: Elbow width is determined when elbows are raised at height of shoulders out to sides. The relatively powerful Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunkif torso is positioned forward beyond vertical Elbows should be kept same height as shoulders when approaching upper chest. Much lighter resistance is required as Cable Seated Row.
ShouldersCBRearDeltRow.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBOneArmRearDeltRow.name: Cable One Arm Rear Delt Row
ShouldersCBOneArmRearDeltRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp stirrup cable attachment with one hand. Straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent. Point elbow out to side.
ShouldersCBOneArmRearDeltRow.execution: Pull stirrup out to side, elbows up shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrist to follow elbow. Keep upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat.
ShouldersCBOneArmRearDeltRow.comments: The relatively powerful Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunkif torso is positioned forward beyond vertical Elbow should be high, approaching same height as shoulder. Much lighter resistance is required as Cable One Arm Seated Row.
ShouldersCBOneArmRearDeltRow.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowRope.name: Cable Standing Rear Delt Row (with rope)
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowRope.preparation: Stand facing rope attachment on high pulley cable. Grasp each end of rope just above enlarged ends. Step back with one foot so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowRope.execution: Pull rope to upper chest or neck, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Keep upper arms perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended forward. Repeat.
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowRope.comments: The relatively powerful Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunkif torso is positioned forward beyond vertical Also see movement with stirrup cable attachments .
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowRope.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBRearDeltRowStirrups.name: Cable Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
ShouldersCBRearDeltRowStirrups.preparation: On dual pulley seated row machine, sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp both cable attachments. Place feet on vertical platform. Position torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent and cable taut. Point elbows outward.
ShouldersCBRearDeltRowStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
ShouldersCBRearDeltRowStirrups.comments: Dual pulley cables should be positioned approximately shoulder height or not much lower. The relatively powerful Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunkif torso is positioned forward beyond vertical Much lighter resistance is required than on Cable Seated Row. Also see movement seated with feet on floor.
ShouldersCBRearDeltRowStirrups.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.name: Cable Seated Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.preparation: Sit on seat facing twin pulley cables positioned shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Straighten lower back upright so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.comments: The relatively powerful Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunkif torso is positioned forward beyond vertical Also see movement on cable seated row apparatus.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.name: Cable Standing Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.preparation: Stand facing twin pulley cables positioned shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Step back with one foot so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.comments: The relatively powerful Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunkif torso is positioned forward beyond vertical Also see movement on cable seated row apparatus.
ShouldersCBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBRearLateralRaise.name: Cable Rear Lateral Raise
ShouldersCBRearLateralRaise.preparation: Stand with cable columns to each side. Grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Bend knees and bend over at hips, so torso is approximately horizontal with back straight. Point elbows outward with arms slightly bent.
ShouldersCBRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and slight bend in elbows as arms are raised to sides. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersCBRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel perpendicular to torso to minimize latissimus dorsi involvement. Elbows may bend slightly at bottom of movement (as shown) or they may be kept fixed. If low back cannot be kept straight due to inflexibility of hamstrings, try keeping knees bent more.
ShouldersCBRearLateralRaise.stabilizers: wristextensors, hamstrings, erectorspinae, gluteusmaximus, tricepsbrachii, adductors, quadriceps
ShouldersCBRearLateralRaise.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersCBOneArmRearLateralRaise.name: Cable One Arm Rear Lateral Raise
ShouldersCBOneArmRearLateralRaise.preparation: Stand with side to low pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment with hand furthest from pulley. Bend knees slightly and bend over with resting arm to side of low pulley.
ShouldersCBOneArmRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise arm to side until elbow is shoulder height. Maintain upper arm perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10 to 30 angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat. Repeat with other arm.
ShouldersCBOneArmRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize Latissimus Dorsi involvement.
ShouldersCBOneArmRearLateralRaise.stabilizers: wristextensors, hamstrings, erectorspinae, gluteusmaximus, tricepsbrachii, adductors
ShouldersCBOneArmRearLateralRaise.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersCBSeatedRearLateralRaise.name: Cable Seated Rear Lateral Raise
ShouldersCBSeatedRearLateralRaise.preparation: Sit at edge of bench with feet of floor ahead of knees. Rest torso on thighs. Reach under legs and grasp stirrup cable attachments, right hand holding left stirrup, left hand holding right stirrup.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10 to 30 angle) throughout exercise. Lower until arms contact sides of legs. Repeat.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize Latissimus Dorsi involvement. If stirrups are not within reach, training partner can hand exercises cable attachments. Alternatively, before sitting on bench, stirrups can be pulled in from each side and switched to opposite hands under legs by temporarily securing one stirrup with hooked thumb from behind, so released opposite hand can retrieve other stirrup from behind.
ShouldersCBSeatedRearLateralRaise.synergists: infraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

ShouldersCBStandingCrossRow.name: Cable Standing Cross Row
ShouldersCBStandingCrossRow.preparation: Stand between two shoulderhigh cable pulleys (adjustable crossover machine). Grasp right stirrup with left hand and left stirrup with right hand. Step back until cables are angled back 30 to 45. Position both elbows at height of shoulders, one over other.
ShouldersCBStandingCrossRow.execution: Pull both cable attachments by moving elbows back to sides. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return and repeat.
ShouldersCBStandingCrossRow.comments: Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if elbows drop below shoulders.
ShouldersCBStandingCrossRow.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersCBOneArmCrossRow.name: Cable One Arm Standing Cross Row
ShouldersCBOneArmCrossRow.preparation: Facing shoulder height cable pulley, grasp stirrup cable attachment with one hand, palm orientated down. Step back and turn body inward about 30 to 45 to face extended arm about. Stand back just enough to allow arm to be fully extended with weight raised up slightly.
ShouldersCBOneArmCrossRow.execution: Pull stirrup back with elbow up at shoulder height until elbow travels just behind shoulder. Keep upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
ShouldersCBOneArmCrossRow.comments: The relatively powerful Latissimus Dorsi becomes involved if upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunkif torso is positioned forward beyond vertical
ShouldersCBOneArmCrossRow.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, brachioradialis, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, teresminor
